result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan L. Sandona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Morgan L. Sandona is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Morgan L. Sandona was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with any drug users or distributors, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in custody with Atty Andrea Rufo.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 922 - Sentence recommendations made.  Defendant is sentenced to 3.5 years in the WSP; 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision - concurrent to Marinette County cases 15CF118, 15CF43.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. Court costs ordered. No restitution requested. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
